channel.title: Wildlife Highlights, HD, short version
channel.itunes:author: Earth-Touch.com
channel.description: The wildlife highlights show features all the best recent footage from Earth-Touch.com in one show. This is a great way to get a bite size package of the wildlife happenings Earth-Touch has seen around the world. These shows are free to all.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The wildlife highlights show features all the best recent footage from Earth-Touch.com in one show. This is a great way to get a bite size package of the wildlife happenings Earth-Touch has seen around the world. These shows are free to all.

channel.itunes:keywords: wildlife, Earth-Touch, Earth-Touch.com, reality, animals, HD, high-definition, high, definition, video, nature, environment, earth

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 51 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Animals thrive on the plains of the Serengeti after rains rapidly transform the landscape into a lush grazing ground.

An Asian barred owlet is unperturbed by the presence of our camera crew in Thailand's Huai Kha Khaeng wildlife sanctuary.

We also visit Indonesia's Sumatra Island where a baby orangutan plays in the branches under the watchful eye of its mother.
item.itunes:subtitle: Animals thrive on the plains of the Serengeti after rains rapidly transform the landscape into a lush grazing ground. An Asian barred owlet is unperturbed by the presence of our camera crew in Thailand's Huai Kha Khaeng wildlife sanctuary. We also visit
item.itunes:summary: Animals thrive on the plains of the Serengeti after rains rapidly transform the landscape into a lush grazing ground. An Asian barred owlet is unperturbed by the presence of our camera crew in Thailand's Huai Kha Khaeng wildlife sanctuary. We also visit Indonesia's Sumatra Island where a baby orangutan plays in the branches under the watchful eye of its mother.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 50 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In the Okavango Delta, two packs of wild dogs have joined forces, sparking interesting interactions as the pack members jostle for rank.

Our crew encounters a venomous violin spider and an endangered toad in a cave system on Indonesia's Rinca Island.

Finally, we head to the cold waters of the Antarctic Peninsula to take a closer look at the different types of ice in this unique area.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Okavango Delta, two packs of wild dogs have joined forces, sparking interesting interactions as the pack members jostle for rank. Our crew encounters a venomous violin spider and an endangered toad in a cave system on Indonesia's Rinca Island. F
item.itunes:summary: In the Okavango Delta, two packs of wild dogs have joined forces, sparking interesting interactions as the pack members jostle for rank. Our crew encounters a venomous violin spider and an endangered toad in a cave system on Indonesia's Rinca Island. Finally, we head to the cold waters of the Antarctic Peninsula to take a closer look at the different types of ice in this unique area.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 49 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Male ostriches chase each other across the plains of Savuti as they compete for dominance. In a Thai forest, a komodo dragon rests while macaques feed in the mangrove trees above.

Maggots and brightly coloured flies make quick work of a carcass in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal and the setting sun illuminates some aquatic life on a lake in Pichit, Thailand.
item.itunes:subtitle: Male ostriches chase each other across the plains of Savuti as they compete for dominance. In a Thai forest, a komodo dragon rests while macaques feed in the mangrove trees above. Maggots and brightly coloured flies make quick work of a carcass in South
item.itunes:summary: Male ostriches chase each other across the plains of Savuti as they compete for dominance. In a Thai forest, a komodo dragon rests while macaques feed in the mangrove trees above. Maggots and brightly coloured flies make quick work of a carcass in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal and the setting sun illuminates some aquatic life on a lake in Pichit, Thailand.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 48 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A variety of animals, from ostriches to elephants, browse on the marsh plains of the Okavango Delta.

On the high-altitude volcanic slopes of Indonesia's Lombok Island, a troop of macaques forage for food, while combretum trees in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal provide a meal for the larvae of emperor moths.
item.itunes:subtitle: A variety of animals, from ostriches to elephants, browse on the marsh plains of the Okavango Delta. On the high-altitude volcanic slopes of Indonesia's Lombok Island, a troop of macaques forage for food, while combretum trees in South Africa's KwaZulu-
item.itunes:summary: A variety of animals, from ostriches to elephants, browse on the marsh plains of the Okavango Delta. On the high-altitude volcanic slopes of Indonesia's Lombok Island, a troop of macaques forage for food, while combretum trees in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal provide a meal for the larvae of emperor moths.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 47 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Marooned fish provide a meal for birds and crocodiles in the Okavango Delta, and the crew has an unnerving encounter with an Asian elephant in Thailand.

A forest in KwaZulu-Natal is home to some of nature's smaller creatures and crabs wrestle for food in Mozambique's Vamizi Bay.
item.itunes:subtitle: Marooned fish provide a meal for birds and crocodiles in the Okavango Delta, and the crew has an unnerving encounter with an Asian elephant in Thailand. A forest in KwaZulu-Natal is home to some of nature's smaller creatures and crabs wrestle for food in
item.itunes:summary: Marooned fish provide a meal for birds and crocodiles in the Okavango Delta, and the crew has an unnerving encounter with an Asian elephant in Thailand. A forest in KwaZulu-Natal is home to some of nature's smaller creatures and crabs wrestle for food in Mozambique's Vamizi Bay.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 46 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A leopard in the Okavango Delta hunts newborn impala lambs and the crew enjoys a rare sighting of a binturong in Thailand.

Sharks, tuna and masses of snapper thrive on a busy reef in Mozambique's Vamizi Bay.
item.itunes:subtitle: A leopard in the Okavango Delta hunts newborn impala lambs and the crew enjoys a rare sighting of a binturong in Thailand. Sharks, tuna and masses of snapper thrive on a busy reef in Mozambique's Vamizi Bay.
item.itunes:summary: A leopard in the Okavango Delta hunts newborn impala lambs and the crew enjoys a rare sighting of a binturong in Thailand. Sharks, tuna and masses of snapper thrive on a busy reef in Mozambique's Vamizi Bay.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 45 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A mega-herd of elephants moves across the floodplains of the Okavango Delta and barbels survive despite harsh conditions in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province. In Thailand, flies hang in single file on the supporting strands of spiders' webs.

We also watch as conservationists in Mozambique excavate a green turtle nest in order to free any hatchlings that have not yet made it to the surface.
item.itunes:subtitle: A mega-herd of elephants moves across the floodplains of the Okavango Delta and barbels survive despite harsh conditions in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province. In Thailand, flies hang in single file on the supporting strands of spiders' webs. We also
item.itunes:summary: A mega-herd of elephants moves across the floodplains of the Okavango Delta and barbels survive despite harsh conditions in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province. In Thailand, flies hang in single file on the supporting strands of spiders' webs. We also watch as conservationists in Mozambique excavate a green turtle nest in order to free any hatchlings that have not yet made it to the surface.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 44 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A large buffalo herd grazes in the Okavango Delta and a meerkat family digs for insects and grubs in the long grass of Botswana's Makgadikgadi Pans.

In South Africa's KwaZulu Natal, millipedes feed on decaying food matter as a thunderstorm approaches. We end with a look at the fascinating corals of Mozambique's Skunk Alley dive site.
item.itunes:subtitle: A large buffalo herd grazes in the Okavango Delta and a meerkat family digs for insects and grubs in the long grass of Botswana's Makgadikgadi Pans. In South Africa's KwaZulu Natal, millipedes feed on decaying food matter as a thunderstorm approaches.
item.itunes:summary: A large buffalo herd grazes in the Okavango Delta and a meerkat family digs for insects and grubs in the long grass of Botswana's Makgadikgadi Pans. In South Africa's KwaZulu Natal, millipedes feed on decaying food matter as a thunderstorm approaches. We end with a look at the fascinating corals of Mozambique's Skunk Alley dive site.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 43 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A cheetah mother suckles her cub after feeding on an impala carcass in the Okavango Delta and an array of birds forage for food in Zambia's Kafue National Park.

Finally, well-camouflaged terrapins extend their snouts for a breath of air in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park.
item.itunes:subtitle: A cheetah mother suckles her cub after feeding on an impala carcass in the Okavango Delta and an array of birds forage for food in Zambia's Kafue National Park. Finally, well-camouflaged terrapins extend their snouts for a breath of air in Thailand's Tho
item.itunes:summary: A cheetah mother suckles her cub after feeding on an impala carcass in the Okavango Delta and an array of birds forage for food in Zambia's Kafue National Park. Finally, well-camouflaged terrapins extend their snouts for a breath of air in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 42 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Ground squirrels and meerkats forage for food on the dusty Makgadikgadi Pans and Darryl Sweetland films an oriental whip snake as it slides along a tree branch in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park.

Next, Grant Brokensha journeys through the marine basins of the Palau rock islands and the crew travels 2685 metres above sea level to film ice rats in the snow of the Lesotho mountains.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ground squirrels and meerkats forage for food on the dusty Makgadikgadi Pans and Darryl Sweetland films an oriental whip snake as it slides along a tree branch in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park. Next, Grant Brokensha journeys through the marine
item.itunes:summary: Ground squirrels and meerkats forage for food on the dusty Makgadikgadi Pans and Darryl Sweetland films an oriental whip snake as it slides along a tree branch in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park. Next, Grant Brokensha journeys through the marine basins of the Palau rock islands and the crew travels 2685 metres above sea level to film ice rats in the snow of the Lesotho mountains.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 41 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A leopard bolts for cover as a troop of baboons gives chase in Botswana's Okavango Delta and Boris von Schoenebeck films ice rats warming themselves in the early morning sunlight in Lesotho's Sani Pass region.

The crew films an array of animals in the afternoon light in Thailand's Phetchabun province and we end off with a rare sighting of three juvenile brown hyenas on the Makgadikgadi Pans in Botswana.
item.itunes:subtitle: A leopard bolts for cover as a troop of baboons gives chase in Botswana's Okavango Delta and Boris von Schoenebeck films ice rats warming themselves in the early morning sunlight in Lesotho's Sani Pass region. The crew films an array of animals in the af
item.itunes:summary: A leopard bolts for cover as a troop of baboons gives chase in Botswana's Okavango Delta and Boris von Schoenebeck films ice rats warming themselves in the early morning sunlight in Lesotho's Sani Pass region. The crew films an array of animals in the afternoon light in Thailand's Phetchabun province and we end off with a rare sighting of three juvenile brown hyenas on the Makgadikgadi Pans in Botswana.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 40 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In this week's episode, wild dogs make quick work of an impala carcass in the Okavango Delta and the crew travel to Lesotho's Sani Pass to marvel at the transformation of the Drakensberg wetlands.

Next, Darryl Sweetland discovers a multitude of bird species in Thailand and a pair of eye-catching nudibranchs cling to a seaplane wreck in South Africa.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this week's episode, wild dogs make quick work of an impala carcass in the Okavango Delta and the crew travel to Lesotho's Sani Pass to marvel at the transformation of the Drakensberg wetlands. Next, Darryl Sweetland discovers a multitude of bird spec
item.itunes:summary: In this week's episode, wild dogs make quick work of an impala carcass in the Okavango Delta and the crew travel to Lesotho's Sani Pass to marvel at the transformation of the Drakensberg wetlands. Next, Darryl Sweetland discovers a multitude of bird species in Thailand and a pair of eye-catching nudibranchs cling to a seaplane wreck in South Africa.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 39 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
We journey to Thailand this week, where cameraman Darryl Sweetland films a common kingfisher as it snatches its prey from a pool of water.

Next, a leopard successfully kills a vervet monkey in the Okavango Delta and the crew spends some time filming a large number of tiny frogs and tadpoles in a pool on the Makgadikgadi pans in Botswana.

Finally, termites become the victims of an attack by a burrowing wolf spider, as it injects its prey and drags it into its hole.
item.itunes:subtitle: We journey to Thailand this week, where cameraman Darryl Sweetland films a common kingfisher as it snatches its prey from a pool of water. Next, a leopard successfully kills a vervet monkey in the Okavango Delta and the crew spends some time filming a la
item.itunes:summary: We journey to Thailand this week, where cameraman Darryl Sweetland films a common kingfisher as it snatches its prey from a pool of water. Next, a leopard successfully kills a vervet monkey in the Okavango Delta and the crew spends some time filming a large number of tiny frogs and tadpoles in a pool on the Makgadikgadi pans in Botswana. Finally, termites become the victims of an attack by a burrowing wolf spider, as it injects its prey and drags it into its hole.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 38 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A procession of freshwater prawns makes its way over rocky obstacles in Thailand and we take a look at the elephants of the Okavango from a new vantage point.

Bat-eared foxes in Botswana start their day with some affectionate interaction and a flurry of activity hits South Africa's Malgas Island as the resident gannets construct their nesting mounds.
item.itunes:subtitle: A procession of freshwater prawns makes its way over rocky obstacles in Thailand and we take a look at the elephants of the Okavango from a new vantage point. Bat-eared foxes in Botswana start their day with some affectionate interaction and a flurry of
item.itunes:summary: A procession of freshwater prawns makes its way over rocky obstacles in Thailand and we take a look at the elephants of the Okavango from a new vantage point. Bat-eared foxes in Botswana start their day with some affectionate interaction and a flurry of activity hits South Africa's Malgas Island as the resident gannets construct their nesting mounds.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 37 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In this episode, we travel to Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park where cameraman Darryl Sweetland discovers a variety of interesting tadpoles.

Next, an elephant calf with a damaged tail and trunk searches the ground for food amongst attentive herd members.

A jackal uses its acute sense of hearing to hunt for insects on the Makgadikgadi Pans in Botswana.

We end off with a trip to South Africa's Northern Cape, where Paul Myburgh films a female steenbok suckling her fawn.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we travel to Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park where cameraman Darryl Sweetland discovers a variety of interesting tadpoles. Next, an elephant calf with a damaged tail and trunk searches the ground for food amongst attentive herd m
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we travel to Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park where cameraman Darryl Sweetland discovers a variety of interesting tadpoles. A jackal uses its acute sense of hearing to hunt for insects on the Makgadikgadi Pans in Botswana. We end off with a trip to South Africa's Northern Cape, where Paul Myburgh films a female steenbok suckling her fawn.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 36 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In our first clip this week, we head to South Africa's Malgas Island, where cameraman Paul Myburgh films a massive colony of nesting gannets.

Next, elephants churn up dust as they dig for roots, their movements almost mirroring one another in the orange glow of the Okavango sunset.

Animals that live on the Makgadikgadi Pans have learnt to adapt to the harsh, dry conditions. In our next clip, ostriches, springbok and kori bustards congregate at one of the last remaining sources of water.

Finally, cameraman Barry Skinstad catches up with a penguin colony in South Africa's Western Cape as the birds begin to emerge from their nests.
item.itunes:subtitle: In our first clip this week, we head to South Africa's Malgas Island, where cameraman Paul Myburgh films a massive colony of nesting gannets. Next, elephants churn up dust as they dig for roots, their movements almost mirroring one another in the orange
item.itunes:summary: In our first clip this week, we head to South Africa's Malgas Island, where cameraman Paul Myburgh films a massive colony of nesting gannets. Next, elephants churn up dust as they dig for roots, their movements almost mirroring one another in the orange glow of the Okavango sunset. Animals that live on the Makgadikgadi Pans have learnt to adapt to the harsh, dry conditions. In our next clip, ostriches, springbok and kori bustards congregate at one of the last remaining sources of water. Finally, cameraman Barry Skinstad catches up with a penguin colony in South Africa's Western Cape as the birds begin to emerge from their nests.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 35 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In the first clip this week, the crew spends some time filming vultures at a busy waterhole.

Next, we travel to the Okavango Delta, where a herd of giraffe is seen drinking at a pan and feeding on the pale green flowers of the Kalahari apple-leaf tree.

Botswana's Makgadikgadi Pans form the backdrop for a rare sighting next, as an aardwolf finds shelter from the cold in a small burrow.

In our final clip, cameraman Barry Skinstad films an array of interesting sea creatures, including an impressive whale shark, as he explores a reef off the coast of Mozambique.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the first clip this week, the crew spends some time filming vultures at a busy waterhole. Next, we travel to the Okavango Delta, where a herd of giraffe is seen drinking at a pan and feeding on the pale green flowers of the Kalahari apple-leaf tree.

In our final clip, cameraman Barry Skinstad films an array of interesting sea creatures, including an impressive whale shark, as he explores a reef off the coast of Mozambique.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 34 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
We start this episode with two very different hunting strategies. Jackals hunt for their breakfast in Namibia's Etosha National Park and a young male leopard fails to bring down a kudu in Botswana's Okavango.

In Thailand's Phu Kiew Wildlife Sanctuary, the air is filled with the loud chirping of cicadas, while birds drink side by side at a pool of water during a dry spell in Botswana's Makgadikgadi Pans National Park.
item.itunes:subtitle: We start this episode with two very different hunting strategies. Jackals hunt for their breakfast in Namibia's Etosha National Park and a young male leopard fails to bring down a kudu in Botswana's Okavango. In Thailand's Phu Kiew Wildlife Sanctuary, th
item.itunes:summary: We start this episode with two very different hunting strategies. item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 33 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
We start off the week in Namibia's Etosha National Park, where an elephant takes time out for a cooling mud bath.

On the edge of a mopane forest in the Okavango, baboons begin their day with grooming and soaking up the sun.

We also visit a gannet colony on South Africa's Malgas Island and take a close-up look at a beautiful pit viper in Thailand.
item.itunes:subtitle: We start off the week in Namibia's Etosha National Park, where an elephant takes time out for a cooling mud bath. On the edge of a mopane forest in the Okavango, baboons begin their day with grooming and soaking up the sun. We also visit a gannet colo

We also visit a gannet colony on South Africa's Malgas Island and take a close-up look at a beautiful pit viper in Thailand.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 32 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In this episode, an oryx carcass attracts the attention of several hungry scavengers, including a lone hyena.

From toenails to eyelashes, cameraman Brad Bestelink takes a close-up look at elephants as the huge animals feed in Botswana's Okavango.

We end off with another close-up encounter, this time with Thailand's mildly venomous Oriental whip snake.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, an oryx carcass attracts the attention of several hungry scavengers, including a lone hyena. From toenails to eyelashes, cameraman Brad Bestelink takes a close-up look at elephants as the huge animals feed in Botswana's Okavango. We end

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 31 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
This week, ground squirrels forage by the roadside in Namibia's Etosha National Park and kudus shelter from the August wind in Botswana's Okavango.

Our crews also film langurs and macaques in the treetops of Thailand's Khao Sam Roi Yot National Park and capture the aggressive feeding strategies of blennies along South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal coast.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, ground squirrels forage by the roadside in Namibia's Etosha National Park and kudus shelter from the August wind in Botswana's Okavango. Our crews also film langurs and macaques in the treetops of Thailand's Khao Sam Roi Yot National Park a

item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 30 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Our latest episode plays out near the water. Graceful oryx head for a waterhole in Namibia's Etosha National Park while elephants move out of dense mopane forest to cross a water channel in the Okavango.

Fiddler crabs go about their business on a sandy beach in Thailand and young chicks thrive at a lakeside cormorant colony in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our latest episode plays out near the water. Graceful oryx head for a waterhole in Namibia's Etosha National Park while elephants move out of dense mopane forest to cross a water channel in the Okavango. Fiddler crabs go about their business on a sandy b
item.itunes:summary: Our latest episode plays out near the water. item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 29 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
It's all about hunting and feeding in our latest Wildlife Highlights episode.

Jackalberry trees provide an easy meal for baboons in the Okavango and a water-filled ditch becomes a hunting ground for frogs in Thailand's Mae Wong National Park.

In Botswana's Nxamaseri channel, a drowning bird is quickly snatched up by a hungry crocodile.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's all about hunting and feeding in our latest Wildlife Highlights episode. Jackalberry trees provide an easy meal for baboons in the Okavango and a water-filled ditch becomes a hunting ground for frogs in Thailand's Mae Wong National Park. In Botswan
item.itunes:summary: It's all about hunting and feeding in our latest Wildlife Highlights episode. In Botswana's Nxamaseri channel, a drowning bird is quickly snatched up by a hungry crocodile.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 28 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
The Khao Yai National Park in Thailand is our first destination this week. Darryl Sweetland films an array of butterflies as the insects feed on the salts and minerals on the ground.

In Botswana's Okavango, jackalberry trees have come into fruit, providing a convenient meal for vervet monkeys and impala in the middle of the dry winter.

Finally, Brad Bestelink spends some time filming some of the most remarkable inhabitants of the Nxamaseri channel in the Okavango Delta – the Nile crocodiles.

In Botswana's Okavango, jackalberry trees have come into fruit, providing a convenient meal for vervet monkeys and impala in the middle of the dry winter. Finally, Brad Bestelink spends some time filming some of the most remarkable inhabitants of the Nxamaseri channel in the Okavango Delta the Nile crocodiles.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 27 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darryl Sweetland travels to a Thai temple that has become a safe haven for thousands of Lyle's flying foxes.

On a chilly morning in the Okavango, animals of all shapes and sizes gather at Jesse's Pools, a series of lagoons surrounded by mopane forest.

We end off with the underwater wonders of the Nxamaseri Channel in Botswana.

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 26 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A passing column of termites catches the eye of cameraman Darryl Sweetland in this week's episode.

Next, a day in the Okavango Delta is filled with exciting wildlife sightings. Brad Bestelink films zebras, a pride of lions and an unfamiliar leopard.

We end off with ice and snow in Lesotho's Sani Pass region and some comical bird behaviour in South Africa's Western Cape.

Brad Bestelink films zebras, a pride of lions and an unfamiliar leopard. We end off with ice and snow in Lesotho's Sani Pass region and some comical bird behaviour in South Africa's Western Cape.

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 25 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Cameraman Pierre Minnie visits a biodiversity hotspot in our first clip this week. South Africa's Garden Route National Park is a haven for countless waterbirds and other wildlife.

Next, animals in the Okavango enjoy water in abundance after a rainy week.

In Thailand's Phichit Province, flowering shrubs attract a variety of insects and other small creatures.

Finally, Boris von Schoenebeck films the animal inhabitants of the mysterious mangrove swamps in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cameraman Pierre Minnie visits a biodiversity hotspot in our first clip this week. South Africa's Garden Route National Park is a haven for countless waterbirds and other wildlife. Next, animals in the Okavango enjoy water in abundance after a rainy week

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 24 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In our first clip this week, rare wild dogs play along the river bank in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park.

In South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal, the air is abuzz with insects seeking out nectar. Along the Eastern Cape coast, common dolphins lead the camera crew to some sardine action.

Finally, lions keep a close watch on a buffalo herd as dawn breaks in the Okavango Delta.

item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 23 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Darryl Sweetland is lucky enough to film gibbons and their young as they move cautiously through the trees in Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park.

Back on the African continent, Boris von Schoenebeck films cocktail ants working tirelessly to gather honeydew for their colony.

A shoal of sardines off South Africa's eastern coast draws hungry predators, including countless birds and common dolphins.

Finally, a lion pride's unsuccessful hunt is captured on film by cameraman Brad Bestelink.

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 22 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
This week's episode includes a special video about the fate of bluefin tuna in the Gulf of Mexico. The Deepwater Horizon oil spill could wipe out this endangered species. The bluefin tuna's spawning habitat overlaps with the oil-spill zone and the disaster comes right at the peak of spawning season.

Our latest episode also includes footage of animals gathering at Nyamithi Pan in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal and Asian elephants crossing a meadow towards a salt lick in Thailand’s Khao Yai National Park.

In the gloomy waters off South Africa's eastern coast, ragged-tooth sharks await the arrival of sardine shoals. Finally, in the Okavango Delta, a large buffalo herd wanders across dry grasslands at sunset.

item.itunes:summary: This week's episode includes a special video about the fate of bluefin tuna in the Gulf of Mexico. The Deepwater Horizon oil spill could wipe out this endangered species. The bluefin tuna's spawning habitat overlaps with the oil-spill zone and the disaster comes right at the peak of spawning season. Our latest episode also includes footage of animals gathering at Nyamithi Pan in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal and Asian elephants crossing a meadow towards a salt lick in Thailands Khao Yai National Park. In the gloomy waters off South Africa's eastern coast, ragged-tooth sharks await the arrival of sardine shoals. Finally, in the Okavango Delta, a large buffalo herd wanders across dry grasslands at sunset.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 21 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province, a pride of lions rests in thick undergrowth after a night-time hunt.

Next, we travel to Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park for a look at spiders of all shapes and sizes, including hairy tarantulas and a huge orb-web spider.

Back on the African continent, the beauty of South Africa's Karoo region is captured on film by Paul Myburgh.

We end the week in the Okavango, where Brad Bestelink films hyenas as they scavenge the remains of a lion kill.

item.itunes:summary: In South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province, a pride of lions rests in thick undergrowth after a night-time hunt. Next, we travel to Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park for a look at spiders of all shapes and sizes, including hairy tarantulas and a huge orb-web spider. Back on the African continent, the beauty of South Africa's Karoo region is captured on film by Paul Myburgh. We end the week in the Okavango, where Brad Bestelink films hyenas as they scavenge the remains of a lion kill.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 20 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Spectacular landscapes and huge skies greet cameraman Pierre Minnie in the Golden Gate Highlands National Park in South Africa.

In Thailand's Kanchanaburi Province, the pollen-gathering activities of stingless bees are captured on film by cameraman Darryl Sweetland. Back on the African continent, Paul Myburgh films another industrious insect: the harvester ant.

Our final destination is the Okavango Delta in Botswana, where Brad Bestelink films elephant bulls at sunset.
item.itunes:subtitle: Spectacular landscapes and huge skies greet cameraman Pierre Minnie in the Golden Gate Highlands National Park in South Africa. In Thailand's Kanchanaburi Province, the pollen-gathering activities of stingless bees are captured on film by cameraman Darry
item.itunes:summary: Spectacular landscapes and huge skies greet cameraman Pierre Minnie in the Golden Gate Highlands National Park in South Africa. In Thailand's Kanchanaburi Province, the pollen-gathering activities of stingless bees are captured on film by cameraman Darryl Sweetland. Back on the African continent, Paul Myburgh films another industrious insect: the harvester ant. Our final destination is the Okavango Delta in Botswana, where Brad Bestelink films elephant bulls at sunset.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 19 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
In our first clip this week, cameraman Pierre Minnie is captivated by the weathered arches and sheer cliffs of Echo Ravine in South Africa's Free State.

Next, we travel to the Okavango Delta, where a lion pride's foray into rival territory ends in a hasty retreat.

In South Africa's Karoo region, common river frogs absorb the warmth of the winter sun on the edge of a small pond.

We end the week in Thailand's Khao Yai National Park, where cameraman Darryl Sweetland films an array of forest creatures, including a beautiful Chinese water dragon.

item.itunes:summary: In our first clip this week, cameraman Pierre Minnie is captivated by the weathered arches and sheer cliffs of Echo Ravine in South Africa's Free State. Next, we travel to the Okavango Delta, where a lion pride's foray into rival territory ends in a hasty retreat. In South Africa's Karoo region, common river frogs absorb the warmth of the winter sun on the edge of a small pond. We end the week in Thailand's Khao Yai National Park, where cameraman Darryl Sweetland films an array of forest creatures, including a beautiful Chinese water dragon.
item.itunes:keywords: wildlife, nature, animals, earth-touch.com, earth, planet

item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 18 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
Dung beetles perform their vital role as nature's recyclers in this week's first clip.

In Thailand's Thong Pha Phum National Park, cameraman Darryl Sweetland films blue-bearded bee-eaters as the birds tend to their well-hidden chicks.

Next, mother dolphins and their calves interact in the deep waters off South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal coast.

Our final clip takes us to the Okavango Delta, where cameraman Brad Bestelink films lions stalking a large buffalo herd.

item.itunes:summary: Dung beetles perform their vital role as nature's recyclers in this week's first clip. item.title: Wildlife podcast, week 17 2010
item.itunes:author: Earth-Touch
item.description:
A golden orb-web spider catches the eye of cameraman Graham Springer in this week's episode. These large spiders build exceptionally strong webs, strong enough to trap small birds.

In Thailand's Khao Yai National Park, Darryl Sweetland is puzzled by the strange behaviour of praying mantises and spots a camouflaged caterpillar.

In the waters of Lake Malawi, a female cichlid fish makes every effort to protect her young fry from danger.

We end off in South Africa's Northern Cape, where the beauty of a flamingo flock in the morning light is captured on film by cameraman Paul Myburgh.

channel.media:description: The wildlife highlights show features all the best recent footage from Earth-Touch.com in one show. This is a great way to get a bite size package of the wildlife happenings Earth-Touch has seen around the world. These shows are free to all.
